name: BlockDataHelper
description: The `BlockDataHelper` class is a comprehensive helper class in JSMacros that provides access to block data and properties at specific positions in the Minecraft world.
overview:
It combines information about a block's state, position, and entity data (if the block has a tile entity) into a single, convenient interface.

This class is primarily used in world interaction contexts where you need to access detailed information about blocks in the world, such as in event handlers or when scanning the world for specific block types.

### How to Access
`BlockDataHelper` instances are typically obtained through:

- **Block Events**: Many block-related events provide `BlockDataHelper` objects
- **World Methods**: When querying blocks at specific coordinates
- **Raycasting**: When targeting blocks with line of sight

methods.name: getX
methods.description: The X coordinate of the block.

methods.name: getY
methods.description: The Y coordinate of the block.

methods.name: getZ
methods.description: The Z coordinate of the block.

methods.name: getBlockPos
methods.description: A position helper for the block's location.

methods.name: getId
methods.description: The block ID (e.g., "minecraft:stone", "minecraft:oak_log"). This returns the registered block ID in the format "namespace:block_name".

methods.name: getName
methods.description: The translated name of the block. Before version 1.6.5, this returned a plain string. Now it returns a TextHelper object.

methods.name: getBlockState
methods.description: Block state properties as key-value pairs. Example: For a door, this might return `{"facing": "north", "open": "false", "half": "lower"}`.

methods.name: getBlockStateHelper
methods.description: A helper object providing detailed block state information. This provides access to more advanced block state properties like hardness, luminance, etc.

methods.name: getBlock
methods.description: A helper object for the block type.

methods.name: getBlockHelper
methods.description: A helper object for the block type. **Deprecated**: Use `getBlock()` instead. This method still works but is kept for backward compatibility.

methods.name: getNBT
methods.description: The NBT data of the block's tile entity. Returns `null` if the block has no tile entity. Before version 1.6.5, this returned a `Map<string, string>`. Only blocks with tile entities (chests, furnaces, signs, etc.) will have NBT data.

methods.name: getRawBlock
methods.description: The raw Minecraft Block object (advanced use only).

methods.name: getRawBlockState
methods.description: The raw Minecraft BlockState object (advanced use only).

methods.name: getRawBlockEntity
methods.description: The raw Minecraft BlockEntity object (advanced use only).
